results.title: Royal river [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Roger Blais, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The picturesque St. Lawrence, Canada’s river of history, welcomes Queen Elizabeth II to the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway. Many close-ups of the Queen, Prince Philip and President Eisenhower are shown. The theme of the film is the river’s history, from its discovery by French explorers to its opening to the shipping of the world. This is an abridged version.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: John Rich, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.

results.title: Roundabout
results.creator_credit: Rachel Griffiths, Jason Byrne, Louise Smith, 3rd Pictures and Igloo Films
results.brief_description: A stressed businessman experiences a panic attack after he hits a dog in his car on his way to work. Spiralling out of control he drives in endless circles, unable to stop. Photography, Tristan Milani ; music, David Bridie ; editing, Geordie Anderson. Cast: David Roberts, Alison Whyte, Kym Gyngell.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arnie Custo, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley, Helen Watts, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Welcome Back”, the ghosts see their chance to stage a comeback in the play being performed to celebrate Port Niranda’s bicentenary. In “Monster Under the Bed” the Lintmonster under Bronson’s bed demonstrates the dire consequences of neglecting the cleaning. In “Linda Godiva”, Linda becomes invisible. Peter turns into a werewolf in “Dog By Night”. In “TV Or Not TV” all the Twist kids get (literally) sucked into their TV. “Face The Fear” has Bronson colliding with hidden loot, ghosts and escaped convicts in the local cemetery. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Rosemary's baby [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, William Castle and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A glossy, psychological horror thriller based on Ira Levin’s best seller of the power of witchcraft to destroy lives. Rosemary (Mia Farrow) is the unsuspecting wife whose actor husband (John Cassavetes) becomes involved with a witches coven. Rosemary’s pregnancy precipitates sinister happenings and she soon discovers that not even Dr. Sapirstein (Ralph Bellamy), a respected obstetrician is to be trusted. Sidney Blackmer and Ruth Gordon (who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her performance) are the ghastly neighbours with diabolical designs on Rosemary’s infant. “Rosemary’s Baby” plays on fears even more potent and atavistic than “Psycho.” Co-starring Maurice Evans, Angela Dorian and Patsy Kelly.

results.title: Round the twist Series 4 - Volume 7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Arnie Custo, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley, Helen Watts, Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. In “Hair Brain” Linda gets an advantage in her campaign for election to the student council after a weird experience with hair products. In “The Princess and the Pete” Pete finds the course of true love doesn’t run smoothly. “Boy Bird” has Bronson discovering a magical singer; while in “The Shadow Player” Linda gets some bad news from her own shadow. “Radio Da Da” sends Linda and Peter time travelling, and Bronson performs good but smelly deeds as “Skunkman”. In “Isle of Dreams” the Twists meet the Princess of Atlantis and have a difficult decision to make. Based on the books by Paul Jennings.

results.title: Roughnecks: the Pluto campaign
results.creator_credit: Audu Paden, Chris Berkeley, David Hartman, Jay Oliva, Sam Liu and Adelaide Productions
results.brief_description: Using computer animation, “Roughnecks: The Pluto campaign” is five episodes from the American TV series. Based on the novel by Robert Heinlein, this series shares the same source material as the feature film “Starship troopers” (Verhoeven, 1997). On planet Pluto giant bugs are on the loose, threatening the lives of space station workers. A crack team of military crew (that naturally consists of a pair of new and green recruits) is dropped there on a mission to eliminate the bugs, no questions asked. Once there they discover that the task is much harder than envisioned and personal politics and feelings start to interfere with the mission as the danger from the marauding bugs increases. Bearing the aesthetic hallmarks of “Aliens” in its design, “Roughnecks” also mimics the space crew’s banter, tensions and infighting. The animation of the show is impressive but highlights the difficulties that arise for artists attempting to re-create human expressions. Funny and funky, “Roughnecks” is an entertaining series that doesn’t go anywhere new dramatically but has some witty one-liners and a great sense of the absurd. Cast includes Clancy Brown, Elizabeth Daily, David DeLuise, Bill Fagerbakke, Nicholas Guest.

results.title: Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead
results.creator_credit: Tom Stoppard, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman, Cinecom Entertainment and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Let Richard Dreyfuss, Tim Roth and Gary Oldman take you one a medieval misadventure, getting themselves in and out of trouble to tell the “true” story (with a few hilarious distractions along the way) of one of the most famous stories of all time.

results.title: Roseland
results.creator_credit: Octavio Iturbe, Walter Verdin, Wim Vandekeybus, Audiovisuele Dienst K U Leuven and Alive From Off Center, Beeldhuis, Twin Cities Public Television, Ultima Vez and VRT
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. This dance video, made from the material of Vandekeybus’ first three choreographies with the company, places these performances in the remarkable setting of a dilapidated Brussels cinema which had been abandoned for the past twenty years. Using a range of cinematic techniques, the film radiates a particular fascination of its own, transforming the theatrical energy of the stage choreography into a dynamic screen experience. For more information go to http://www.ultimavez.com/
